meanings.definition: Covered or wrapped in a sheet.
meanings.sent1: The bed was sheeted in a soft, white fabric.
meanings.sent2: The patient was sheeted in a warm blanket.
meanings.sent3: The ghost costume was sheeted in a glow-in-the-dark material.
meanings.sent4: The landscape was sheeted in a blanket of snow.
meanings.sent5: The car was sheeted in a layer of dust, making it hard to see the color.

meanings.sent1: The hotel room was sheeted with clean, crisp linens.
meanings.sent2: The bed was sheeted with soft, cotton sheets.
meanings.sent3: The picnic table was sheeted with a checkered cloth for the party.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was sheeted with colorful posters and educational materials.
meanings.sent5: The office was sheeted with important documents and reports, organized neatly.

meanings.definition: Made of or resembling a sheet.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a sheeted sculpture out of metal.
meanings.sent2: The cake was sheeted with a smooth layer of fondant.
meanings.sent3: The costume was sheeted with shiny fabric to mimic armor.
meanings.sent4: The building was sheeted with glass panels, reflecting the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The lake was sheeted with a thin layer of ice, shimmering in the winter sun.
